Name: adiponitrile production | adiponitrile | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of adiponitrile from butadiene and hydrogen cyanide.;The reaction takes place in several steps, first a monohydrocyanation (the addition of one molecule of HCN) of butadiene, forming isomers of pentenenitriles as well as 2- and 3-methylbutanenitriles. The nitriles are isomerized to 3-and 4-pentenenitriles in the following step. In the final step, the pentenenitriles are hydrocyanated a second time in an anti-Markovnikov fashion to produce adiponitrile. The reactions are catalysed by a copper halide catalyst, this catalyst in not consider significant in terms of emissions for the reaction and it is therefore not included in the dataset.;C4H6 + HCN --> C5H7N;C5H7N + HCN --> C6H8N2;Reference(s):;Musser, M. (2011): Adipic Acid, Ullmann's Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry, Weinheim, Wiley-VCH.
